intro: Coccoloba nipensis, commonly known as the St. Croix coral tree, is a shrub or small tree native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are often red or purple when young, and its showy, clustered flowers that range from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and landscapes in tropical and subtropical regions.
